revised_title: Effect of Specimen Size on Crack Growth in Viscoelastic Media
tldr: The author investigates the effect of specimen size on crack growth in viscoelastic media, calculating the strain energy release rate required to propagate a crack at a given velocity. The analysis predicts a region of negative gradient, which may explain instability phenomena observed in polymer fracture. The study also shows that large specimens have greater apparent fracture surface energy than small ones.
